item.title: How to Paste over Selected Text without Overwriting the Unnamed Register in Vim
item.description: Summary: paste with P in visual mode. It’s painful to paste over selected text in Vim, because the unnamed register is overwritten by the selected text. Thus, we can not paste the original yanked text twice. If you have a file: 1 2 hello kitty You want to copy hello , paste it over kitty, and paste it again. You type these commands in Vim. 1 2 3 4 5 gg " move to the top yy " copy current line jV " move to the next line and select it p " paste over the select line p " paste again You expect to get:
